title: 108_hr2433
content: The Act titled "Health Care for Veterans of Project 112/Project SHAD Act of 2003" provides health care to veterans who participated in Department of Defense chemical and biological warfare testing. Section 1710(e) of title 38, United States Code, is amended to provide hospital care, medical services, and nursing home care for veterans who participated in chemical and biological warfare testing from 1962 through 1973, including Project Shipboard Hazard and Defense (SHAD) tests, regardless of medical evidence linking their illnesses to the testing. In paragraph (3), amendments are made to provide care for veterans involved in chemical and biological warfare testing from 1962 to 1973, including Project SHAD tests, without requiring medical evidence linking their illnesses to the testing. Improvements to the retention and recruitment of health care professionals include new promotion standards for nurses without baccalaureate degrees. Registered nurses meeting performance requirements for promotion will not be denied advancement based on lack of a baccalaureate degree in nursing. SEC. 4 amends Section 7454(b) of title 38, United States Code to provide additional pay for Saturday tours of duty for additional health care workers in the Veterans Health Administration. Employees appointed under section 7408 are entitled to additional pay similar to nurses. The amendment applies to pay periods starting after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 5 extends additional employment laws to employees of Veterans' Canteen Service. The amendment allows employees appointed under section 7408 to be considered for Department positions in the competitive service and count previous Service employment towards time-in-service requirements. Technical amendments include punctuation changes and removing references to the Secretary. The Secretary shall establish locations for canteens, warehouses, storage depots, space, buildings, structures, equipment, services, and utilities. Subsections are redesignated and realigned accordingly. The Secretary shall establish locations for canteens, warehouses, storage depots, space, buildings, structures, equipment, services, and utilities. Subsections are redesignated and realigned accordingly, with specific instructions for personnel, contracts and agreements, prices, gifts and donations, rules and regulations, and delegation. The Secretary may authorize the Authority To Cash Checks, Etc. The House of Representatives passed the bill on September 10, 2003.
